title: Teams Tab App - not getting updated on Teams iOS Clients when new version is deployed
body:
### Steps to reproduce

i have a teams tab app which supports offline capability using serviceworker. when a new version of the app is deployed , i am seeing latest version on teams desktop client but Teams iOS ignores the update and continue to show the old cached version of the app. when i tried to troubleshoot, i see the service worker is not getting registered on Teams iOS Client. 

### Expected behavior

Teams iOS Client als should get refreshed when a new version is deployed.

### Actual behavior

Teams iOS Client on iPad keeps showing the previous cached version.service worker is not getting registered.
the instructions given here to enable devTools does nt work
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/tabs/how-to/developer-tools#activate-devtools-for-your-teams-ios-client



### Error details

_No response_

[I ran into an issue] Step 3: Import messages
body:
### Type of issue

Other (describe below)

### Feedback

Dear Sirs:
Our domain don't allow we call Graph by user account directly, but they offer us an application ID and its secret.
I suppose we need to use these information to call Graph function?
But I'm not sure how to send a post by application.

We try to add below parameter:
   Bearer *Application Secret* 
   Content-type "application/json"
 on the "Request header" (From https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/api/chatmessage-post?view=graph-rest-1.0&tabs=java#request-headers)

but it returns this error:
"error":{
      "code":"Unauthorized",
      "message":"Message POST is allowed in application-only context only for import purposes. Refer to https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoftteams/platform/graph-api/import-messages/import-external-messages-to-teams for more details.",
      "innerError":{
         "date":"2025-05-13T01:33:55",..

I would like to ask:
1. Do we use this application correctly?
2. If 1 is no, how do we call Graph by this application?
3. If 2 if yes, how can we fix the error?

### Page URL

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/graph-api/import-messages/import-external-messages-to-teams#step-3-import-messages

### Content source URL

https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/msteams-docs/blob/main/msteams-platform/graph-api/import-messages/import-external-messages-to-teams.md

@AkJo

### Document Id

ce77e760-90cf-e6b1-3cec-ae55ee50c33e

### Platform Id

c9cc8ad3-6c28-7c8c-af03-219bbefa1d38

title: Use Teams tab in SharePoint - Teams app package uploading into SharePoint App catalog doesn't work
body:
<!-- Failed to upload "Screenshot 2025-05-14 105452.png" -->

### Type of issue

Feature doesn't work (bug)

### Feedback

As per the description "[Use Teams tab in SharePoint](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/tabs/how-to/tabs-in-sharepoint#use-teams-tab-in-sharepoint)", we should be able to import the helloworld teams package into SharePoint without any modifications. However when we try import [the package](https://github.com/OfficeDev/Microsoft-Teams-Samples/blob/main/samples/app-hello-world/csharp/demo-manifest/app-hello-world.zip) into SharePoint app catalog, we get the error "Provider hosted app package validation error.  One of the required properties is null".

title: [I ran into an issue] Upload the bot in Teams
body:
### Type of issue

Select an option

### Feedback

The instructions to zip the file say:  

1. In your cloned repository, go to Microsoft-Teams-Samples > samples > bot-conversation-sso-quickstart > **csharp_dotnetcore > BotConversationSsoQuickstart**.
2. Create a .zip file with the following files that are present in the appPackage folder:

The appPackage is under TeamsApp, not what you have in step 1, BotConversationSsoQuickstart, for example:

C:\Users\...\source\repos\Microsoft-Teams-Samples\samples\bot-conversation-sso-quickstart\ **csharp_dotnetcore\TeamsApp\appPackage**

title: BUG: Documentation specifies channelData.team.id will be channel team GUID but is actually duplicated channelid.
body:
### Type of issue

Code doesn't work

### Feedback

Documentation specifies that team id property should specify the team ID not the channel ID,
```
channelData.team.id | Team ID (if the request was made in a channel).
```
([Source](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/messaging-extensions/how-to/action-commands/create-task-module?tabs=dotnet#payload-activity-properties-when-a-dialog-is-invoked-from-a-channel-new-post))

But example in documentation shows actual behavior which erroneously duplicates the channel ID in both the channel and team properties,
```  
"channelData": {
    "channel": {
      "id": "19:6decf54d86d945e4b3924b63a9161a78@thread.skype"
    },
    "team": {
      "id": "19:acca514e83cb497e960e0b014d405336@thread.skype"
    },
```
([Source](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/messaging-extensions/how-to/action-commands/create-task-module?tabs=dotnet#example-3))
**Note**: team.id should be a **GUID** not a conversation identifier. **This is not just a documentation error** but the actual Teams Client also displays this erroneous behavior making it impossible to use some API methods in response to this event.

The team ID (which is needed for many API endpoints for Channel resource in Graph API) is not specified anywhere in the actual payload of the composeExtension/fetchTask invoke type. Believe this same issue exists with other invoke type payloads.

This is critical missing information and there appears to be no method of retrieving a team GUID for a specified channel via API. This blocks the use of major API methods in response to this invoke payload event.


### Page URL

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/messaging-extensions/how-to/action-commands/create-task-module?tabs=dotnet

### Content source URL

https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/msteams-docs/blob/main/msteams-platform/messaging-extensions/how-to/action-commands/create-task-module.md

### Author

@surbhigupta

### Document Id

2ee29289-b250-4ba3-e957-7a42122a266e

### Platform Id

9f5af4a7-fc8c-6524-edc7-e67af5ed4a4b
